moves.1. e4: I start with my usual e4.
moves.3. Nf3: Here the usual is d4 or c4, but I go for simple development.
moves.4. Bc4 e6 5. Nc3 c6: I think this move is unnecessary, because d5 knight is already well protected, and there is no way I can attack it. Also it blocks b8 knight.
moves.6. O-O Be7 7. d4: I choose d4 rather than d3, because I didn't want to block my white bishop. The point was opening the c1-h6 diagonal.
moves.7... O-O 8. Nxd5: I was taught that centralized knight is very strong, so I removed him.
moves.8... exd5: Here I think better is cxd5, keeping the center strong.
moves.9. Bd3 Bg4 10. Re1 Nd7 11. h3: Every time my knight on f3 is pinned, that makes me nervous. So its time to chase that bishop away.
moves.11... Bh5: Of course Bh5, keeping the pin alive. I wont play g4, because it would opened my King too much.
moves.12. Bf4: I don't think this is the best move. It do nothing other than occupying h2-b8 diagonal. What do you thing dear reader?
moves.12... Bf6 13. c3: Here I was thinking to play Bd6, 13. ....Re8, 14. Rxe8 Qxe8 15. c4. But then I would leave g5 square and give away the only open file. So I just protect my hanging d4 pawn. Then I saw something!
moves.14. Bxh7+: ! I saw this sacrifice. If 14. ...Kxh7 then 15. Ng5+ Bxg5 16. Qxh5+ Kg8 17. Bxg5, and the black Queen must move. If the King moves either to h8 or f8, I get a pawn, but the must important, I bust open his King defence.
moves.14... Kxh7 15. Ng5+: Now I get a bishop back, I'm a pawn up, my Queen comes into action and I think I have a great advantage.
moves.15... Kg6: ? Mistake, he should leave the bishop and move his King back on the 8 rank. There is mate in 4. Do you see it?
moves.16. Qd3+ Kh6 17. Nxf7#: The only thing in this game I was focus on is to get rid of the pin and at the end I came up with this beautiful mate. Thank you for reading this and I hope you enjoy this annotation. Also thanks to my opponent, for this game.
